thread.title: Bonds little changed amid flat rand | Markets
thread.title_full: Bonds little changed amid flat rand | Markets | BDlive

author: Madeleine van Niekerk
title: Bonds little changed amid flat rand | Markets
text:
Picture: THINKSTOCK SOUTH African bonds were flat at midday on Monday, amid an unchanged rand.
Weak Chinese numbers on Monday morning added to the risk-off sentiment across markets as China's industrial profits fell 8.8% in August from a year earlier, fuelling economic slowdown concerns in China.
US Federal Reserve interest rate hike fears also continue to weigh on markets.
At 11.20am the benchmark R186 bond was bid at 8.485% and offered at 8.480% from a previous close of 8.480%.
The middle-dated R207 was bid at 7.950% and also offered at 7.950% from a Friday close of 7.955%.
The rand was trading unchanged at R13.9044 the dollar from is previous close.
No local data releases are due for release on Monday but look out for US personal spending and income numbers out in the afternoon, Nedbank Capital analysts said in a note.
The International Monetary Fund (IMF) is also expected to revise global growth rates this week, the bank said.
